    Back to Top

    NEW UPDATES

    Skill Sequence System

    Tired of writing an entire essay in MLA format INCLUDING citations before bursting? With the brand new Skill Sequence System, you can bid farewell to the countless times you've said "Wait I need to setup real quick" because in just one press, you're ready to send it!

    • To access the Skill Sequence UI, open the Skill UI and click the ‘Sequence’ button.
    • To create a sequence, click on a sequence row and select the skills you want to add to your lineup.
    • You can customize the sequence layout by clicking ‘Layout Settings’ and creating up to 10 rows, each with its own hotkey. That’s 10 different sequences!
    • Name your sequence by clicking the ‘Sequence Name Settings’ button and the name will be displayed on the hotkey.

    • Toggle ‘Sequence Notifier’ to display icons of used skills on your screen during a sequence.
    • When you press a sequence hotkey, skills will activate in order from left to right at set intervals.
      • Skill effects will display if intervals are set, otherwise effects appear immediately (buffs)
    • The Skill Sequence hotkey displays the longest remaining cooldown of all registered skills. While the cooldown timer is visible, when there is a skill registered to a sequence that can be used, only that skill will be used upon activating the sequence.
    • When a sequence is activated:
      • Skills with active cooldowns or reuse features will not be used.
      • Skills that cannot be used due to insufficient gauge, MP, or other reasons will be skipped, with a system message indicating the reason.
      • If used in the air, skills that cannot be used in the air will be skipped.
      • The sequence will ignore any Abnormal Status effects and gaining one afterward won’t stop the sequence.
    • Skills registered to interaction keys (like arrow keys) won’t respond during sequence activation. For example, Burning Soul Blade assigned to down arrow will stay fixed and won’t summon in the sequence.
    • Skills with Action Customization will operate based on their command/on-off status. For example, Jaguar Storm will only summon Jaguars if turned on during the sequence.

    Back to Top

    Skill Improvements and Changes

    Common Skill Improvements and Bug Fixes

    • [6/11/25] Noblesse Guild Skills (Boss Slayers, Undeterred, For the Guild!, Hard Hitter):
      • Decreased the cooldown from 60 minutes to 5 minutes.
      • Decreased the cost to reuse Noblesse Guild skills from 30,000,000 mesos to 5,000,000 mesos.
      • Changed where Noblesse Guild Skills cannot be used after entering a boss map.
        • Make sure to pop the skills before entering a boss map!
    • Resolved an issue where Adele was unable to use the Advanced Giant Potion immediately after activating a Rune.
    • Resolved an issue where only one debuff among Monkey Fury, Flashbang, and Unicorn Spike was applied.
    • Resolved an issue where some 6th Job skills were missing from the Skill UI when resetting 1st to 4th Job skills.
    • Increased the attack range of Fury of the Wild by approximately 30%.
    • Mastery Node
      • Resolved an issue where the skill level appeared awkward in the description when the Mastery Node is deactivated from using a SP Reset Scroll.
      • Resolved an issue where the deactivation message appeared when enhancing a node when the Mastery Node was inactive.
    • Resolved an issue where the buff icons remained visible even after summons disappeared for the following skills:
      • Decent Holy Fountain
      • Holy Fountain
      • Obsidian Barrier (Burst/Torrent)
      • Drill Salvo
      • HEXA Drill Salvo
    • Resolved an issue where Decent Sharp eyes were being used repeatedly in pet auto-buffs.
    • Resolved an issue where the Skill Notifier did not appear when cooldowns were over for the following skills:
        • Roll of the Dice
        • Grandis Goddess’s Blessing.
        • Buccaneer: Roll of the Dice, Double Down
        • Corsair: Scurvy Summons, Roll of the Dice, Double Down, HEXA Scurvy Summons
        • Cannoneer: Roll of the Dice, Double Down
        • Thunder Breaker: Gale, Typhoon
        • Mechanic: Roll of the Dice, Double Down
    • Resolved an issue where the skill effect transparency did not apply properly for the following skills:
      • Explorer Pirate: Pirate's Banner
      • Explorer Magician: Infinity
      • Hero: Flash Blade, Instinctual Combo
      • Dark Knight: Spear of Darkness
      • Arch Mage (Ice/Lightning): Frost Ward
      • Bishop: Genesis, Heaven's Door
      • Marksman: Ultimate Snipe
      • Night Lord: Frailty Curse
      • Shadower: Meso Explosion, Assassinate, Trickblade
      • Buccaneer: Serpent Scale, Serpent Vortex, Unleash Neptunus
      • Corsair: The Dreadnought
      • Cannoneer: Cannon Barrage, The Nuclear Option
      • Dawn Warrior: Flicker, Flare Slash
      • Blaze Wizard: Orbital Flame
      • Thunder Breaker: Tidal Crash, Ascension, Thunder, Lightning God Spear Strike, Lightning Spear Multistrike
      • Aran: Return to Rien, Adrenaline Overload: Golden Burst, Final Beyond Blade - White Tiger, Finisher - Adrenaline Surge
      • Evan: Mana Burst, Return Flash, Wind Circle, Return Dive, Thunder Circle, Earth Circle, Return Flame, Ludicrous Speed, Zodiac Burst
      • Mercedes: Final Attack: Dual Bowguns, Rising Rush, Aerial Barrage, Unicorn Spike, Gust Dive, Leaf Tornado, Lightning Edge, Rolling Moonsault, Spikes Royale, Spirit of Elluel, Sylvidia's Flight
      • Phantom: Rapier Wit, Penombre
      • Luminous: Liberation Orb, Endless Darkness, Eternal Light
      • Demon Slayer: Dark Thrust, Cerberus Chomp, Demon Awakening
      • Demon Avenger: Exceed: Demon Strike, Nether Slice, Blood Prison
      • Blaster: Rocket Punch, Afterimage Shock
      • Battle Mage: Battle Burst
      • Wild Hunter: Call of the Hunter, White Heat Rush, Hunting Assistant Unit, Drill Salvo
      • Mechanic: Homing Beacon, AP Salvo Plus
      • Xenon: Diagonal Chase
      • Kaiser: Dragon Barrage
      • Kain: Shadow Step
      • Cadena: Muscle Memory, Muscle Memory Finale
      • Zero: Flash Assault, Ego Weapon, Shadow Flash
      • Kinesis: Ultimate - Trainwreck, Ultimate - Psychic Shockwave
      • Adele: Impale, Resonance Rush
      • Illium: Reaction - Destruction, Reaction - Domination, Crystal Skill - Vortex of Light, Crystal Skill - Resonance, Crystal Skill - Wings of Glory, Longinus Spear, Crystal Ignition
      • Khali: Hex: Chakram Split, Hex: Pandemonium, Void Burst
      • Ark: Unstoppable Impulse, Tenacious Instinct, Grievous Wound, Scarlet Charge Drive, Gust Charge Drive, Insatiable Hunger, Boundless Horror, Endlessly Starving Beast
      • Lara: Eruption: Sunrise Well, Eruption: Whirlwind, Land's Connection
      • Hoyoung: Sage: Three Paths Apparition

    Job Skill Improvements and Bug Fixes

    • Hero
      • Final Attack
        • Changed so that Final Attack prioritizes attacking the enemy with the highest max HP first.
      • Advanced Final Attack
        • Changed so that Advanced Final Attack prioritizes attacking the enemy with the highest max HP first.
      • Cry Valhalla
        • Resolved an issue where the same sound effect was played for all sword strikes.
      • HEXA Puncture
        • Resolved an issue with the skill effects volume.
      • HEXA Beam Blade
        • Resolved an issue where the Skill Notifier wasn’t displaying.
    • Paladin
      • Falling Justice
        • Decreased the damage at Lv. 30 from 1560% to 1491%.
        • Changed Falling Justice so that it is now affected by cooldown reduction effects.
      • Sacred Bastion
        • Resolved an issue where the skills cooldown was not applied correctly.
    • Dark Knight
      • Final Attack
        • Changed so that Final Attack triggers when Speak of Darkness hits.
      • Revenge of the Evil Eye
        • Added Revenge of the Evil Eye to the Battle Analysis System UI.
      • HEXA Evil Eye Shock
        • Resolved an issue where the skill could be used consecutively.
    • Arch Mage (Fire, Poison)
      • Meteor Shower
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting Meteor Shower.
      • Creeping Toxin, HEXA Creeping Toxin
        • Resolved an issue where the toxic pool would sometimes incorrectly summon.
      • HEXA Ignite
        • Resolved an issue where the skill had a delay before it could be used again.
      • Elemental Fury
        • Resolved an issue with the skill effects audio.
    • Arch Mage (Ice, Lightning)
      • Blizzard
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting Blizzard.
      • HEXA Blizzard
        • Decreased the action delay of HEXA Blizzard by approximately 13%.
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting HEXA Blizzard.
      • Freezing Crush
        • Resolved an issue where the debuff effect remained even when no stacks were available.
      • Thunder Sphere
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effects were visible in the wrong location for other players.
    • Bishop
      • Divine Protection
        • Improved so that when Unreliable Memory while Divine Protection is active, a system message will indicate the skill cannot be used at the moment.
      • Genesis
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting Genesis.
      • Heaven’s Door
        • Resolved an issue where the casting effect did not display correctly.
      • Holy Water
        • Resolved an issue where Holy Water would sometimes not grant the holy water effect in certain situations.
      • Resolved an issue where the skill sequence of Triumph Feather and Blood of the Divine could not be registered through the Skill UI.
      • Resolved an issue where HEXA Triumph Feather could not be triggered by the following skills:
        • HEXA Angelic Wrath
        • HEXA Genesis
        • HEXA Heaven’s Door

      • Extra Quiver
        • Changed where if Extra Quiver has auto-mode activated, it will not activate automatically in towns.

        • Changed the attack mechanism.

        • Decreased the enemy seeking range by approximately 37.5%.
        • Resolved an issue where Speed Mirage gave the afterimage arrow a wider enemy search range than intended.
      • HEXA Phoenix Drive
        • Resolved an issue where the Skill Notifier wasn’t displaying.

      • Final Attack: Crossbow

        • Changed the attack mechanism.

      • Vanquisher’s Charm
        • Decreased the amount of mana consumed per second from 40 to 25.
        • [Updated 6/11/25] Decreased the cooldown from 60 seconds to 50 seconds.
      • Shikigami Haunting IV
        • Increased the amount of mana restored from 5 to 20.
      • Spirit’s Domain
        • Changed where the final damage increase effect from summoned spirit applies to only apply to your character.
        • Increased the Final Damage from 15% to 36%.
        • Increased the Summoned Spirit Damage by approximately 20%.
        • Increased the number of attacks from 3 to 9.
        • Decreased the cooldown from 196 seconds to 176 seconds.
        • Decreased the skill duration from 75 seconds to 60 seconds.
        • Decreased the mana absorbed to empower the Cursed Spiritstone from 120 to 100.
      • Yuki-musume Shoukan
        • Decreased the cooldown from 75 seconds to 60 seconds.
      • Orochi Unbound
        • Decreased the cooldown from 90 seconds to 60 seconds.
      • Spirit’s Path
        • Increased the Final Damage at Lv. 10 from 20% to 30%.
      • Bellflower Barrier
        • Decreased the cooldown from 180 seconds to 60 seconds.
        • Decreased the skill duration from 100 seconds to 30 seconds
    • Hayato
      • Sudden Strike
        • Changed so that the additional 20% bonus damage applies only to the player and no longer affects party members.
        • Increased the skill duration at Lv.20 from 30 seconds to 60 seconds.
      • Iaijutsu Phantom Blade
        • [Updated 6/11/25] Increased the Final Damage per stack buff duration at Lv. 30 from 33 seconds to 40 seconds.
    • Angelic Buster
      • Encore Ribbon
        • Resolved an issue where Encore Ribbon would sometimes not apply the Affinity Heart IV passive effect.
    • Cadena
      • Summon Spiked Bat
        • Increased the number of attacks from the first hit from 8 to 12.
        • Increased the number of attacks from the 2nd hit from 9 to 13.
        • Increased the number of attacks from the 3rd hit from 10 to 14.
        • Decreased the Damage of the first hit at Lv.30 from 495% to 330%.
        • Decreased the Damage of the 2nd hit at Lv.30 from 640% to 443%.
        • Decreased the Damage of the 3rd hit at Lv.30 from 915% to 653%.
      • Chain Arts: Beatdown
        • Removed Strike from occurring immediately when the max activations of additional hits by Muscle Memory is met within the time.
        • Resolved an issue where the strike effect was not visible to other characters.
      • Summon Scimitar
        • Resolved an issue where using Summon Scimitar while in the air prevented the following hyper skill effects from applying:
          • Chain-less Arts - Reinforce
          • Chain-less Arts - Critical Chance
          • Chain-less Arts - Boss Rush Effects
    • Zero
      • HEXA Wind Cutter
        • Changed the activation requirements for HEXA Wind Cutter to also require the skill Wind Striker/Falling Star Enhancement at Lv. 40.
      • HEXA Giga Crash
        • Changed the activation requirements for HEXA Giga Crash to also require the skill Storm Break/Groundbreaker Enhancement at Lv. 40.
      • Advanced Throwing Weapon
        • Resolved an issue where the summons would sometimes disappear awkwardly.
        • Resolved an issue where summons would spawn outside the map boundaries.
        • Resolved an issue where the summons would face the wrong direction when Assist or Transcendent’s Time Blessing were cast.
        • Resolved an issue where the summons would spin in the opposite direction when casting to the right.
        • Resolved an issue where the Shadow Rain delay varied depending on the character casting it.
        • Resolved an issue where the client would sometimes disconnect when the skill was used.
      • HEXA Throwing Weapon
        • Resolved an issue where the client would sometimes disconnect when the skill was used.
      • Transcendent
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect triggered by Time Blessing, wasn’t visibly to other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill sound effect triggered by Time Blessing was inaudible.
      • Shadow Flash
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect sometimes appeared incorrectly.
      • Time Force
        • Resolved an issue where the Time Force could exceed the maximum limit when the DF/TF/Mana Hyper Stat levels were reset.
        • Resolved an issue where Time Force was consumed after HEXA Shadow Rain ended.
      • Resolved an issue where the character movement appeared awkward after casting the following skills:
        • Falling Star
        • Groundbreaker
        • HEXA Falling Star
        • HEXA Groundbreaker
    • Kinesis
      • Kinetic Combo
        • Changed so that Kinetic Combo triggers when an Ultimate skill is used except for:
          • Ultimate - Psychic Shot
          • Ultimate - B.P.M
          • HEXA Ultimate - Psychic Shot
        • Changed to create only one surrounding object regardless of the number of enemies hit.
        • Changed so that the surrounding object prioritizes attacking the enemy with the highest max HP first.
      • Ultimate - Trainwreck
        • Resolved an issue where the skill sound effect played awkwardly when cast consecutively.
    • Adele
      • Resonance Rush
        • Decreased the Damage at Lv. 10 from 502% to 105%.
      • Ascent
        • Decreased the Damage increase effect of Resonance Rush when Ascent is at Lv. 20 from 125% to 115%.
      • Perfection
        • Decreased the Damage increase effect of Resonance Rush when Perfection is at Lv. 30 from 265% to 170%.
      • Reign of Destruction
        • Added the skill duration to now display as a buff icon that can be canceled by right-clicking.
        • Changed the duration for using the skill again after a cooldown reset effect is applied.
      • Legacy Restoration
        • Removed Sol Janus: Dawn from triggering when Legacy Restoration enhanced with a HEXA Node is used.
      • Noble Summons
        • Resolved an issue where the effects of Aether Forge at Lv. 20 and Noble Summons Boost Node were not applied.
      • Aether Bloom
        • Resolved an issue where the effects of Aether Bloom and Blade Torrent Boos Node were not applied.
      • Shardbreaker
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect was not visible to other players.
        • Resolved an issue where Aether Crystal did not spawn after using Shardbreaker.
      • Impale
        • Resolved an issue where Aether Crystal did not spawn after using Impale.
    • Illium
      • Crystalline Bulwark
        • Changed the skill effects transparency options to no longer apply for you and other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill could not be activated when using HEXA Longinus Spear.
      • Crystalline Spirit
        • Added a command lock feature to this skill. When used, pressing the skill key without arrow keys will consume all Crystal Shards and place all spirits at once.
      • Mytocrystal Expanse
        • Increased the enemy search range by approximately 178%.
        • Resolved an issue where infinite mytocrystals occasionally did not resonate when using Crystal Ignition.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect transparency option was not applied to the resonance effect of infinite mytocrystals.
      • Ex
        • Resolved an issue where the skill did not attack normally.
      • Crystal Skill - Deus
        • Resolved an issue where the Satellite did not attack normally.
      • Deploy Crystal
        • Resolved an issue where the buff icon did not disappear when entering a map that removes buffs upon entry and summoning the mytocrystals.
      • Winged Javelin
        • Resolved an issue where Hero’s Will and Will of Erda would sometimes not activate while using Winged Javelin.
      • HEXA Radiant Javelin
        • Resolved an issue where the mytocrystals shard buff icon sometimes didn’t display correctly
      • HEXA Winged Javelin
        • Resolved an issue where the mytocrystals shard buff icon sometimes didn’t display correctly
        • Resolved an issue where the following skills could not be activated when using HEXA Winged Javelin:
          • Terms and Conditions
          • Aeonian Rise
          • Crystalline Bulwark
      • HEXA Longinus
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect appeared awkwardly to other characters.
    • Khali
      • Void Rush
        • Resolved an issue where using Void Rush after Hex: Chakram Sweep would sometimes cancel the backward jump.
      • Resonate & Resonate: Ultimatum
        • Resolved an issue where the effects of Resonate - Range were applied to the enemy reseek range even if the skill was not learned.
      • Death Blossom
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect was not visible to other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect did not change relative to the enemy’s size
      • HEXA Hex: Chakram Split
        • Resolved an issue where chakrams were pushed back by enemy attacks during casting.
    • Ark
      • Vengeful Hate
        • Increased the attack range by approximately 3000%.
      • HEXA Grievous Wound
        • Added a passive effect that increases the damage of HEXA Vengeful Hate.
      • Endless Agony
        • Resolved an issue where casting the skill would display the action as in progress.
      • Resolved an issue where Endlessly Starving Beast’s activation time did not decrease for the following skills:
        • HEXA Grievous Wound
        • HEXA Insatiable Hunger
        • HEXA Unbridled Chaos.
      • Resolved an issue where the following skills appeared awkward in the Combo Key, Key Bindings, and Buff Favorite settings:
        • HEXA Grievous Wound
        • HEXA Insatiable Hunger
        • HEXA Unbridled Chaos.
      • Resolved an issue where the Buff Duration increase effects were not applied to the following skills:
        • HEXA Basic Cast
        • HEXA Scarlet Cast
        • HEXA Gust Cast
        • HEXA Abyssal Cast
    • Lara
      • Unconstrained Dragon Vein

        • Resolved an issue where Unconstrained Dragon Vein’s could not be created in a Town.
      • Eruption: Whirlwind & HEXA Eruption: Whirlwind
        • Resolved an issue where the skill did not attack enemies when a Giant Potion was active.
      • Wakeup Call
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect displayed incorrectly for other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill casting effect wasn’t visible to other players.
      • Absorption: River Puddle Douse
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect would sometimes not display.
      • Absorption: Fierce Wind

      • Scroll: Star Vortex

    • Lynn
      • [Focus] Awaken
        • Changed the Focal Target’s Final Damage to increase by 1% per 2000 INT, up to a maximum of 50%.
        • Decreased the Focal Target’s starting Final Damage buff from 10% to 5%.
        • Decreased the skill duration from 30 seconds to 20 seconds.
        • [Updated 6/11/25] Decreased the cooldown from 120 seconds to 60 seconds.
      • [Focus] Awaken Boost
        • Decreased the Focal Target’s Final Damage buff from 20% to 10%.

    Back to Top

    Cross World Auction House

    The Auction House has expanded! You can now trade equipment and cash items between worlds!

    • The Auction House will have two regional groupings where specific worlds will share the Auction House.
      • NA Region:
        • Group 1: Scania, Bera, Aurora, Elysium
        • Group 2: Challenger
      • EU Region:
        • Group 1: Luna
        • Group 2: Challenger

    • USE, SET-UP, and ETC items cannot be sold to other worlds.
    • You cannot purchase items that you have registered yourself.
    • If you buy equipment items with Platinum Scissors of Karma applied, they will be claimed as untradable.
    • Cash items purchased at the Auction House are converted to untradable upon claiming, however, some times may still be tradable.
    • Cash items purchased at the Auction House cannot earn Maple Points through rebates.
    • The Purchase All feature is restricted for Cash Items sold from other worlds.
    • When buying items from other worlds, a service fee of 10% of the item cost will be applied. The minimum service fee is 10 Maple Points.
    • Listing items, reclaiming items, and collecting payments are only available in the world where the item was added.
    • Added a feature to search for items in your current world only.
    • Added an icon that displays your character's current world.
    • Added a section that displays how many Maple Points you own.
    • Added an exclusive icon that displays for items sold from other worlds.
    • All items or mesos that need to be claimed before the maintenance on June 11, 2025, can be claimed by clicking the ‘Claim Existing Auction Items’ button in the Complete tab of the Auction House UI by July 11, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.
      • This includes items traded before February 28, 2018 that don’t have a claim period.
    • The ‘Claim Existing Auction Items’ button will be removed, and any unclaimed items will be deleted on July 12, 2026 at 12:00 AM UTC.

    Back to Top

    Cross World Meso Market

    The Cross World Meso Market is now available, allowing players to trade mesos across worlds!

    • The Cross World Meso Market is divided into one regional group, where you can trade mesos across all worlds within that region.
      • NA Region:
        • Group 1: Scania, Bera, Aurora, Elysium, Challenger
      • EU Region:
        • Group 1: Luna, Challenger

    • The Cross World Meso Market will be available once all completed trade costs and deposits from before the maintenance on June 11, 2025 are claimed.
      • To claim, click the ‘Quick Move’ button in a Town map and talk to Miss Richfield.
    • You can request and complete only one trade at a time.
    • During an active trade, trade requests, cancellations, and claiming mesos or Maple Points can only be done in the world where the trade was initiated.
    • You can view ongoing and completed trade history from any world.
    • You can request up to 100 trades a day per account.

    Meso Market Improvement and Changes

    • Added a feature displaying the recent trade data for the average trade costs of 100 billion mesos.
      • The average trade cost automatically updates over time.
    • Added a feature displaying the buyout cost, showing the amount needed to settle in increments of 100 million, 1 billion, or 10 billion mesos.
      • The buyout cost automatically updates over time.
    • Added a feature where you can check the status of ongoing trades and view trade history at any time.
    • Added a ‘Mesos & Maple Points’ button to show details in the chat window when claiming mesos and Maple Points.
    • Added a Revision feature where if a trade is still in progress and not completed, you can cancel it, change the requested price, and re-submit the trade with your new price.
    • Changed so that the completed trade costs can be claimed even if the trade was in progress when completed.
    • Increased the max trade request amount to 100 billion mesos.
    • Increased the maximum number of players waiting to buy or sell from 1,000 to 10,000.

    Back to Top

    Genesis Weapon Awakening Changes

    • Changed the mission completion requirements for Genesis Weapon Awakening to defeating the Commanders’ afterimages and collecting a certain amount of Trace of Darkness.
    • Removed the ‘[Genesis] After the Destined Battle’ quest requirement of destroying the Genesis Crux.
    • The amount of Trace of Darkness needed for each Commanders’ afterimage quest depends on the difficulty.
      • 1,500 Traces of Darkness can be accumulated.
      • Excess Trace of Darkness beyond the required amount for the current Commanders’ afterimage quest will carry over to the next quest.
    • The amount of Trace of Darkness required for each Commanders’ afterimage quest are:
    Commanders’ Afterimage Quest Required Trace of Darkness
    Traces of Von Leon: The Lion King 500
    Traces of Arkarium: The Guardian of Time 500
    Traces of Magnus: The Tyrant 500
    Traces of Lotus: The Wing Master 1,000
    Traces of Damien: The Sword of Destruction 1,000
    Traces of Will: The King of Spiders 1,000
    Traces of Lucid: Keeper of Nightmares 1,000
    Traces of Verus Hilla: The Red Witch 1,000
    • Trace of Darkness can also be extracted from the following bosses:
    Boss Trace of Darkness Extracted Amount
    Lotus (Normal) 10
    Damien (Normal) 10
    Easy Lucid (Easy) 15
    Easy Will (Easy) 15
    Lucid (Normal) 20
    Gloom (Normal) 20
    Will (Normal) 25
    Darknell (Normal) 25
    Versus Hilla (Normal) 45
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) 50
    Damien (Hard) 50
    Lucid (Hard) 65
    Gloom (Chaos) 65
    Will (Hard) 75
    Darknell (Hard) 75
    Verus Hilla (Hard) 90
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme) 600
    • When defeating a boss with a party, the total amount of Trace of Darkness extracted will be divided based on the number of players who entered.
    • [Updated 6/12/25] For players who defeated the Genesis Crux before the maintenance on June 11, 2025:
      • Players who did not complete the Commanders' afterimage quest will automatically receive 100% of the required Trace of Darkness to complete that quest.
      • Players who already completed the Commanders' afterimage quest will not receive the Trace of Darkness.

    Back to Top

    Monster Park Improvements

    • Monster Park
      • Changed the ‘[Monster Park] Daily Medal Challenge’ quest completion requirements from 77 clears per day to either 30 daily clears or 3 Monster Park Extreme.
        • Characters currently working on the ‘[Monster Park] Daily Medal Challenge’ quest will have their progress maintained and will count towards the new quest completion requirements.
        • Updated the description of the ‘Seven Day Monster Parker’ medal to reflect the new quest completion requirements.
    • Monster Park Extreme
      • Monster Park Extreme entry will be closed until June 12 at 12:00 AM UTC for redecoration.
      • Changed the content type from Daily to Weekly.
        • Increased the EXP reward when cleared to 400%.
        • The clear record resets every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.
      • Increased the number of characters per world who can complete Monster Park Extreme each week to 2.
        • Characters who complete Monster Park Extreme for the week will be displayed in the Monster Park Extreme Entry UI.

      • Monster Park Extreme is now excluded from the Sunny Sunday Monster Park EXP bonus perk.
      • Moved the achievement ‘[Monster Park Extreme] From Enemies to Friends’ to the Memory tab and will no longer be available to complete.

    Back to Top

    Epic Dungeon Changes

    • Common
      • Epic Dungeon Entry will be closed until June 12 at 12:00 AM UTC for redecoration.
      • Increased the number of times an Epic Dungeon can be cleared per week per account to 2.
        • Only one type of Epic Dungeon can be cleared per character each week.
        • When entering an Epic Dungeon with your current account, you will only be able to enter Epic Dungeons on that account for the week.
        • When the progress for an Epic Dungeon is reset, the account and world that you can enter on for that week will not reset.
    • Epic Dungeon: High Mountain Stage Changes
      • All Stages
        • Decreased the amount of authority consumed for Sun Surge from 50 to 30.
        • Decreased the amount of authority consumed for Prominence from 150 to 100.
        • Decreased the amount of authority consumed for Solar Flare from 200 to 150.
      • Stages 4 and 5
        • Changed the points required to clear the stage from 3,700 to 2,600.
        • Changed some map structures for Stage 4.
      • Stages 7 and 8
        • Changed the points required to clear the stage from 4,500 to 3,500.
      • Stage 10
        • Increased the damage dealt to Tynos during the Massacre Phase from 20% to 30% of total HP.
    [Dev Team Comment]
    "We’ve identified the cause of the lag occurring in High Mountain and made improvements.
    First, we optimized the art asset of the Golden Bee monster appearing during the last wave of Stage 4, 5 which caused the most lag, and decreased the number of monsters summoned by half. But to make sure there are no changes to the gameplay, the points upon defeating the Golden Bee monster has been increased by 2 times. Additionally, we improved the stuttering issue by preloading the data of monsters that are summoned by a large amount in each wave.
    We will continue to strive to provide a pleasant environment for gameplay."

    Back to Top

    Sol Erda Conversion

    • Access the Sol Erda Conversion feature by clicking the ‘Erda Conversion’ button in the HEXA Matrix or Erda Link UI.

    • Convert your owned Sol Erda into Faint Sol Erda Energy or HEXA Boosters.
    Sol Erda Converted Item Created Quantity
    1 Faint Sol Erda Energy: Tradable within world, expires the day after conversion at 12:00 AM UTC. 30
    HEXA Booster: Tradable within world, expires the day after conversion at 12:00 AM UTC. 1

    • Use a HEXA Booster to summon monsters that give a large amount of EXP when defeated within 100 seconds.
      • Can only be used by characters who have completed the 6th Job Advancement.
      • Must be used in a map where monsters are within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above).

    Back to Top

    Auto-Harvest Profession System Improvements

    • Added a hotkey that can be assigned to open the Auto-Harvest UI.
    • Added a notification feature that can be toggled in the Auto-Harvest UI. Notifications will pop up for the following statuses:
      • When Auto-Harvest is complete.
      • When you log in again while Auto-Harvest is in progress, it shows the remaining time.
      • When the daily Auto-Harvest reset occurs.
      • If Auto-Harvest is available but not yet started.

    • Added Plentyroid to the Profession Credit Shop.
      • Upon equipping Plentyroid, double-click it to open the Auto-Harvest UI.

    • Changed the daily Auto-Harvest limit from 8 hours to 4 hours.
    • Changed so that if a character with an Auto-Harvest in progress exits the game or switches characters, it will automatically resume when that same character logs back in.
      • The Auto-Harvest time does not accumulate when you exit the game or are in the character selection screen.
    • Increased the amount of Profession Credit obtainable per day from 150 Coins to 300 Coins.
    • Increased the amount of Profession Credit obtainable per week from 1,050 Coins to 2,100 Coins.
    • Increased the quantity limits in the Profession Credit Shop for the following items:
    Item Price Old Quantity Limit New Quantity Limit
    Mysterious Mineral Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 50 20 No Change
    Mineral Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select a mineral of your choice and receive x10) 100 5 10
    Mysterious Herb Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 50 20 No Change
    Herb Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select an herb of your choice and receive x10) 100 5 10
    Magic Powder Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select a magic powder of your choice and receive x10) 150 5 10
    Mysterious Magic Powder Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 75 20 No Change
    Mysterious Essence Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 100 10 20
    Essence Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select and obtain either Dusk Essence or Brilliant Dusk Essence) 200 3 10
    Plentyroid Coupon: Tradable within world, 7-day duration.

    Use to receive the following:

    • Plentyroid:
      • Heroic Worlds: Untradable, Permanent.
      • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within world, Permanent.
    		 1,000 N/A Unlimited

    Back to Top

    Link Skill Revamp

    • The daily limit for transferring link skills has been removed.
    • The meso fee required to transfer a link skill more than 5 times has been removed.
    • Changed where transferring, removing, and accessing presets for link skills cannot be used in Boss Battle maps.

    • To access the Link Skill UI, open the Skill UI and double-click on the Link Manager skill in the Beginner tab.
    • Your owned link skills are displayed at the bottom of the Link Skill UI.
    • Click the ‘+’ button on a Link Skill to activate and assign it to a preset.
      • You can set up to three different presets for your link skills.
    • When a link skill is assigned, it will now automatically apply to all characters within the same world who have completed the ‘Teaching Link Skill’ quest.
    • Select the ‘View Link Skills You Don't Own’ checkbox to view all Link Skills you can obtain. Hover over the skills to see detailed information like which job it belongs to and the bonus effects it provides.

    Back to Top

    Quest Improvements and Changes

    Story Quest

    • Changed so that Arcane River and Grandis region Story Quests can now be skipped by characters within the account (instead of within the world).
      • When one character has completed the Arcane River and Grandis region Story Quests, all characters within the same account will have the option to either view the summarized story or immediately skip it without having to complete the prerequisite quests.
      • Viewing the summarized story or skipping the Story Quests will automatically complete all quests associated with it. Item rewards except for EXP will be given.

    • Changed so that prerequisite quests to unlock a Boss can now be skipped by characters within the account (instead of within the world).
      • When one character has completed the prerequisite quests to unlock a Boss, all characters within the same account will have access to the boss content without having to complete the prerequisite quests.
    • Changed so that [Root Abyss] quests can now be skipped by characters within the account (instead of within the world).
      • When one character has completed the ‘[Root Abyss] World Tree Rescue’ quest, all characters within the same account will have the option to skip it in the ‘[Root Abyss] An Urgent Summons’ quest.
      • If characters have completed the ‘[Root Abyss] An Urgent Summons’ quest and the story quest is in-progress, it cannot be skipped.
      • Skipping the quest will automatically complete all quests associated with it. Item rewards except for EXP will be given.

    Symbol Quest

    Grandis

    • Changed the Grandis daily quests completion conditions of defeating monsters to gradually decrease from 500, 300, 100 for that region. The amount is determined by the highest region unlocked.
    • If a Grandis daily quest is in-progress from Wednesday 12:00 AM UTC before the patch until maintenance ends, your progress records will be reset.
    • If a Grandis daily quest is completed from Wednesday 12:00 AM UTC before the patch until maintenance ends, your progress records will be saved.

    Arcane River

    • Changed the Arcane River daily quests completion conditions of defeating monsters to gradually decrease from 500, 300, 100 for that region. The amount is determined by the highest region unlocked.
    • The amount of Arcane Symbols given for clearing the Arcane River special content once has been increased from 15 to 40.

    Symbol Express Pass Discount

    • The Grandis' daily quest instant completion fee is now 1,000, 600, or 200 Maple Points depending on the highest region unlocked.
    • The Arcane River daily quest instant completion fee is now 1,000, 600, or 200 Maple Points depending on the highest region unlocked.

    Arcane River Quest

    Grand Athenaeum: Maple Chronicle

    • The ‘Book of Arcane River' will be temporarily unavailable after the June 11, 2025 maintenance and will return in a future update.

    Vanishing Journey

    • In-progress quests have been reset.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.
    • Added Vanishing Journey related dialogue and cutscenes to the ‘A Greater Power’ quest.
    • Added the following quests:
      • [Vanishing Journey] The World Below the River
      • [Vanishing Journey] The Starting Point of the Arcane River
      • [Vanishing Journey] Folding a Paper Boat
      • [Vanishing Journey] Paper Boat Flowing Upstream

    Reverse City

    • Added dialogue illustrations for some NPCs.

    Chu Chu Island

    • Added navigation to some quests.
    • Changed the chat window for some quests.
    • Added dialogue to some quests.
    • Added ‘[Chu Chu] To Handle Erda’ quest.

    Yum Yum Island

    • Changed the chat window for some quests.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.

    Lachelein

    • Added chat window illustrations of some NPCs.
    • Added navigation to some quests.
    • Changed the chat window for some quests.
    • Added dialogue and cutscenes for some quests.
    • Added the ‘[Lachelein] Dream Within a Dream’ quest.

    Arcana

    • Added navigation to some quests.
    • Changed the chat window for some quests.
    • Added dialogue to some quests.
    • Added the ‘[Arcana] With Determination’ quest.

    Morass

    • Added chat window illustrations of some NPCs.
    • Added dialogue and cutscenes for some quests.
    • Removed the following quests:
      • [Morass] Flying Fish Says Hello
      • [Morass] Life in Morass
      • [Morass] Where Did She Go?
      • [Morass] On the Trail 1
      • [Morass] The Survivor
      • [Morass] The Sealed Door
      • [Morass] The Door that Does Not Open
      • [Morass] To the Lab
      • [Morass] The Fateful Day
      • [Morass] On the Trail 2
      • [Morass] The Path Tana Left
      • [Morass] Wake Up, Fish!
      • [Morass] Crumbling Memories
      • [Morass] Not Yet Time
      • [Morass] Chasing Tana

    Esfera

    • Removed existing in-progress quest records and the quest can no longer be completed.
    • Removed and simplified the content of some quests.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.
    • The following quests have been added:
      • [Esfera] The Strangers
      • [Esfera] A Suspicious Door
      • [Esfera] In Search of the Signal Flare
      • [Esfera] Base Camp
      • [Esfera] Deformed Erda
      • [Esfera] Collecting Erda
      • [Esfera] Traces of Tana
      • [Esfera] Collecting Erda 2
      • [Esfera] The Missing Sun
      • [Esfera] Spider Hunt
      • [Esfera] Spider's Enemy
      • [Esfera] Light and Darkness
      • [Esfera] Will of the World
      • [Esfera] In Search of Tana
      • [Esfera] Her Barrier
      • [Esfera] A Sunken Thing
      • [Esfera] The Trap
      • [Esfera] Temple of Light
      • [Esfera] Into the Mirror
      • [Esfera] Sun and Moon
      • [Esfera] Mirrors in Mirrors

    Sellas

    • The '[Sellas] Chasing the Signal' quest can no longer be completed.
    • The '[Sellas] Voyage to the Bottom' quest completion requirements have been changed.

    Moonbridge

    • Added chat window illustrations of some NPCs.
    • Removed and updated the content of some quests.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.
    • The following quests can no longer be completed:
      • [Moonbridge] Back to Maple World
      • [Moonbridge] Nautilus in Need
      • [Moonbridge] Nautilus Support
      • [Moonbridge] Clearing the Fog
      • [Moonbridge] The Great Edea
      • [Moonbridge] Edea's Investigation
      • [Moonbridge] Closer Inspection
      • [Moonbridge] Shipwreck Rescue
      • [Moonbridge] Guiding Light
      • [Moonbridge] Unleashing the Alliance

    Labyrinth of Suffering

    • Removed existing in-progress quest records and the quest can no longer be completed.
    • Removed and simplified the content of some quests.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.
    • Added the following quests:
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] On the Offensive
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Toward the Black Sun
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Crash Landing Report
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] ire the Signal Flare
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Into the Labyrinth
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Search and Rescue
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] The Only One Left
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Follow the Screams
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Her Story
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] To the Crash Site
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Traces of Despair
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Gap
      • [Labyrinth of Suffering] Source of Suffering

    Limina

    • Removed existing in-progress quest records and the quest can no longer be completed.
    • Removed and simplified the content of some quests.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.
    • Added the following quests:
      • [Limina] Toward the Black Mage
      • [Limina] The Erda Surges
      • [Limina] Guard Captain Darknell
      • [Limina] On the Resistance Ship
      • [Limina] Destiny Defined
      • [Limina] Final Operation
      • [Limina] The Final Foe
      • [Limina] White Mage
      • [Limina] End of War
      • [Afterword] A World in Motion

    Common Quest

    • Lion King’s Castle Quest
      • Added quest to Lion King’s Castle
        • [Lion King's Castle] Finally, Forever
      • Changed the NPC of some Lion King’s Castle quests.
        • Perform the King's Dignity quest through the broken slate.
        • Perform Ifia's Treasure quest through Cecilia.
      • Resolved an issue where players were not able to carry out the quest in [Lion King's Castle] Defeat the Lion King' under certain conditions.
    • Fixing Eos Tower Quest
      • Changed starting requirements for ‘Fixing Eos Tower’ quests.
      • Removed ‘Fixing Eos Tower’ quest from the ‘Ludibrium’s Best Worker is Yours Truly!’ quest achievement.
    • Profession Quest
      • Changed the ‘[Profession] The Professional]’ quest level requirement to Lv. 100.
      • Resolved an issue where the dialogue did not fit the current specs of profession related quests.
        • [Profession] The Professional
        • [Profession] Saffron's Herbalism Lecture
        • [Profession] Cole's Mining Lecture
    • Added guide text to the tab content when the ‘[Black Mage] Destiny Define’ quest is in progress.
    • Changed entry requirement to Lv. 50 in Dead Mine Cave Investigation.
    • Resolved an issue Demon Slayer characters appeared in incorrect locations during the Black Heaven storyline.
    • Resolved an issue where the NPC image would cover the Arcana Daily Quest content.
    • Resolved an issue where certain Medal quests were categorized incorrectly.
    • Resolved an issue where the background music in [Shangri-La] Collapsing Shangri-La 2 would not play.
    • Resolved an issue where players were not able to start the ‘[Esfera] In Search of Tana’ quest again when forfeited.
    • Resolved an issue when the ‘[Genesis Weapon] Trailing the Traces of the Black Mage' quest was in progress, the Black Mage’s Binding debuff did not disappear when leaving a party midbattle against Von Leon.
    • Resolved an issue where the 2nd round bonus effect guide appeared awkward when the FriendStory episode reset.
    • Resolved an issue where the map guide appeared awkward in ‘[Cernium (After)] Library in Flames’.
    • Resolved an issue where Mirror-touched Sea 3 and 4 appeared during the Quest UI’s Navigation function for '[Morass] Rage of the King'.
    • Resolved an issue where some quests were not visible in the Quest UI because it was not included in the correct category:
      • [Ghost Park] Normal Mode Challenge
      • [Ghost Park] Normal Mode Super Challenge
      • [Ghost Park] Normal Mode Survival Challenge
    • Resolved an issue where the achievement count did not count when completing the following Tallahart Daily Quests:
      • ‘[Daily Quest] What a Lovely Day for a Quest’
      • ‘[Daily Quest] What a Gloomy Day… It’d be Better with a Daily Quest!’
      • ‘[Daily Quest] What Boring Day. Let’s do a Quest!’

    Back to Top

    UI Improvements and Changes

    Legion Placement UI

    • Improved Legion Member Placement Mode UI
      • Added a filler feature that categorizes the Legion Member list by job.

    • Added Legion Member Automatic Placement Feature
      • Use the Legion Member Automatic Placement feature by clicking the Automatic Placement button in the Legion Member Placement Mode UI.
      • When you use Automatic Placement, it will search for a suitable position after you select the member and the placement area.
      • If you successfully find the placement result that matches the selected setting, you can instantly apply the result to the Legion Member Placement Mode.

    Medal/Title Appearance UI

    You can now customize how your Medal or Title appears on your character!

    • Access the UI by opening your character's Equipment Inventory UI, then click the ‘Medals/Titles’ button.
    • Both the Medal and Title sections have an Equip slot and an Appearance slot.
      • Only one Medal and one Title can be displayed at a time, regardless of equipment presets.

    Equip Slot

    • When a Medal/Title is registered in the Equip slot, both the effects and appearance will be applied to your character.
    • When an item is equipped here, its icon will appear grayed out in the Appearance slot.

    Appearance Slot

    • When a Medal/Title is registered in the Appearance slot, only the image and text of the items are applied.
      • You can toggle whether you want to display the appearance of the Medal/Title by clicking the ‘Display Medal/Title’ box.
      • If a Medal with a Fusion Anvil applied is registered in the Appearance slot, the fused item’s appearance will be displayed.
    • If there isn’t anything registered in the Equip slot, the appearance cannot be displayed. Regardless if an item is registered in the Appearance slot.

    Medal UI

    A brand new Medal UI is here! Redesigned to be easier to navigate with improved features that help you view, sort, and celebrate the Medals you’ve earned throughout your MapleStory journey.

    • Access the Medal UI by clicking the ‘Menu’ icon then ‘Medal’ near your quickslots or by pressing the ‘Medal’ hotkey.
    • The Medal UI has two main tabs: Medal Collection and Medal Quest.

    Medal Collection

    • In the Medal Collection tab you can view and sort all your registered Medals in one place.
    • Medals can also be sorted by the following options:
      • Newest First
      • Oldest First
      • A - Z
      • Z - A
    • Current equipped Medals will display an equipped icon in the list.

    Medal Quest

    • In the Medal Quest tab, you can view your in-progress and see available Medal-related quests.
      • Categories within this tab can be filtered to focus on what you’d like to do!

    Additional Features

    • Hovering over any Medal will show a full preview with details.
    • A search feature is available to quickly find specific Medals or Medal related quests.

    Quest UI

    All quest-related UIs have been reorganized making it easier to track your progress and manage!

    • Access the Quest UI by clicking the ‘Menu’ icon then ‘Quest Log’ near your quickslots or by pressing the ‘Quest’ hotkey.
    • Quests are now categorized by type and each type has its own dedicated tab in the Quest UI:
      • Story: Main quests, Job advancements, Events, and general story content
      • Repeat: Daily and Weekly quests
      • Guide: Helpful progression content
      • Cash: Quests related to Cash items, Maple Rewards, and time-limited events
    • Each tab has an area with a feature tailored to its quest type, to help manage and complete quests more easily.
      • Story: Quests can be filtered by Required, Job Advancement, Skill, Region, Boss, Content, System
      • Repeat: A button that opens the Maple Planner
      • Guide: A button that links to our Official Guides on the website
      • Cash: A button that opens the Cash Shop

    • Quests in each tab are sorted into three sections:
      • In-Progress
        • The listed quests are sorted based on the following:
          • Quests that can be completed
          • Recommended quests
          • Frequently accessed categories
          • Quests within your level range
      • Available
      • Completed

    • Quests that are not within your level range are displayed in a lighter color.
    • Clicking the text of an NPC’s name, enemy, or map name in the Quest Info UI to automatically highlight their locations on the world map.
    • Event Participation quests have been removed from the UI.

    Quest Notifier

    • Increased the amount of quests that can be added to the quest notifier from 5 to 20.
      • If the quest helper is full, the quest at the bottom will be removed automatically.
    • Completed or newly added quotes will move to the top of the list.
    • New quests are added to the notifier automatically if there’s space.

    NPC Quests

    • Quest names in NPC dialogue will display a category icon next to the name.

    Lightbulb UI

    • Quests in the in the lightbulb UI will follow the same sorting as the Quest UI:
      • Recommended quests
      • Frequently accessed categories
      • Quests within your level range

    Key Binding UI

    • Added custom key binding features to allow easier settings for basic key bindings and quickslots.
      • Saved key binds are by account and are applied upon character creation and key binding reset.
      • Note that some jobs do not allow key binding within the tutorial map or when characters are newly created. Key binds can be made within the Key Binding UI menu once the tutorial ends.
    • Added import preset feature.
      • You can import and copy the key bind information of another preset.
    • Adjusted so when you hover your cursor over the buttons in the key bindings UI, the tooltip of that feature is output

    Emoticon UI

    • Added emoticon image output to chat window upon using emoticon input rules.
      • Displays emoticons in the chat box or Maple Chat when adding “ : “ to both sides of the emoticon name.
      • Displays a preview of an emoticon with the relevant text in the auto-completion list above the chat when adding” : “ and certain texts in the chat box.

    • This feature only applies for emoticons you own.
    • You cannot use emoticons in Megaphone items.
    • Added Favorites feature to allow registering emoticons to Favorites
      • Click the Favorites button of the emoticon slot (located at the upper right of each emoticon) to add to Favorites.
    • Added Key Bindings UI Connection button to Emoticon UI.
    • Added the following basic emoticons:
    Name Emoticon
    Orange Mushroom
    Pepe
    Pink Bean
    Yeti
    Rock Spirit
    Roo-bot
    Chu Chu
    Island Tomboy
    Desert Rabbit
    Boss Battle

    Chat Window UI

    • The internal/external Chat Window UI has been updated and positions of some buttons have been adjusted.

    • Added Chat Window setting UI
      • When clicking the Chat Window settings button, a new UI will display for chat fonts and other various chat settings.
      • You can now set the fonts and colors of the text in default conversation and party chats.
      • There are a total of 24 different font colors.
      • Settings related to the chat window can no longer be changed within the Options UI.
    • The Battle tab for the internal and external chat window has been renamed to the Etc tab.

    Common UI

    • Updated the information text displayed when attempting to access Special Content from a map that isn't in the Maple Guide UI.
    • Resolved an issue where the Hyper Burning designation button would appear in the character selection screen when it’s not a Hyper Burning event.
    • Resolved an issue where cash items couldn’t be equipped in the Cash Shop Preview.
    • Changed so you can view your current Maple Points in the Epic Dungeon Rewards and Bonus Rewards UI.
      • Hovering over the “Select Bonus Reward’ button will display how many Maple Points are required.
    • Improved the previews for Auction House and Cash Shop:
      • Added previews for attack motions with the current equipped weapon.
        • The attack motion will not play if a weapon is not equipped or a special action is active.
      • Cash weapon effects are visible in the preview, even if the weapon type doesn’t match your equipped weapon.
      • Changed where basic attack animations now reflect the correct weapon type when Guns, Claws, Dual Blowguns, Hand Cannons, Soul Shooters, or Whispershots are equipped.
    • Added a blacklist icon to display next to the name of a character or guild that you’ve added to your blacklist.
    • Changed the Change Character Name UI.
    • Changed the design of several system confirmation windows.
    • Changed the button designs in Evan and Zero’s skill books.
    • Resolved an issue where the cooldown end notification appeared in the wrong locations.
    • Increased the amount of cooldown end notifications displayed up to 3 at a time.
    • Improved where double-clicking on a monster's image in the Monster Collection will automatically highlight its location in the world map.
    • Changed where existing Sharenian Culvert through the portal or NPC Daedal in ‘Path from the Altar’ a message will now pop up confirming if you want to exit or stay.
    • Resolved an issue where some hotkey functions were awkward when the Guild UI was open.
    • Resolved an issue where tooltips would appear upon hovering over the bottom area, even when the Tallahart region wasn’t exposed in the Symbol Express Pass UI.
    • Resolved an issue where the Raid Power of a non-logged-in character was displayed as a negative number after Raid Power was added in the character selection window.
    • Resolved an issue where players sometimes couldn’t enter Maple Chronicle in Grand Athenaeum even when not doing anything else.
    • Resolved an issue where the completion window did not close after Profession’s Production was finished.
    • Resolved an issue where descriptions did not display when hovering over V Matrix and HEXA Matrix in Evan and Zero Skill Books.
    • Resolved an issue where the 10-minute guild mark change cooldown was not applied immediately after upload.
    • Resolved an issue where the 'Back to Original' and 'Save' buttons did not activate after resetting hotkeys in the Hotkey Setting UI.

    Back to Top

    Boss/Mob Improvements and Changes

    Boss Reward Party Distribution System

    Blink for loot parties just got safer! With the new Boss Reward Party Distribution System, drops are automatically distributed to all party members, so no more loot swiping!

    • To change the Pick-Up Rights, click the ‘Settings’ button in the Party UI and select ‘Distribution’
    • When the pick-up rights are set to Distribution, rewards are divided equally among all party members via the Boss Reward UI that appears after defeating a boss.
      • All party members will receive the Power Rebirth Crystal, while other items are distributed randomly.
      • If a player leaves the party or map during the distribution setup, they will not be considered part of the reward distribution.
      • Solo parties will always have Pick-Up Rights set to ‘All’, regardless if Distribution is the selected setting.

    • For higher value items, when Distribution is enabled, each party member will receive a random number between 1 and 999 after the boss is defeated for a special distribution. The player with the highest number wins the reward.
      • If not all party members participate in the distribution, it will still proceed as if everyone is involved.
    • Rewards obtained through the Distribution system can be claimed in the Boss Rewards tab of the Storage Room UI.
    • Special distribution will occur for the following items:
    Boss Item
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) Damaged Black Heart
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) Berserked
    Lotus (Extreme) Total Control
    Damien (Hard) Magic Eyepatch
    Lucid (Hard) Dreamy Belt
    Will (Hard) Cursed Spellbook Coupon
    Gloom (Chaos) Endless Terror
    Guard Captain Darknell (Hard) Commanding Force Earring
    Verus Hilla (Hard) Source of Suffering
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme) Genesis Badge
    Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme) Mitra's Rage Selection Box
    Black Mage (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Belt)
    Chosen Seren (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Face Acc)
    Kalos the Guardian (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Eye Acc)
    Kaling (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Earrings)
    Limbo (Hard) Whisper of the Source
    Lotus (Extreme) White Jade Boss Ring Box
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme)
    Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme)
    Kalos the Guardian (Easy, Normal)
    Kaling (Easy, Normal)
    Kalos the Guardian (Normal, Chaos) Grindstone of Life
    Kaling (Normal, Hard)
    Kalos the Guardian (Chaos, Extreme) Divine Eternal Armor Box
    Kaling (Hard, Extreme) Ferocious Beast Eternal Armor Box
    Limbo (Hard) Eternal Armor of Desire Box

    Common Boss and Mob

    • Kaling
      • The position of the Interact/Harvest skill UI is now saved.
    • Limbo (Normal, Hard)
      • Resolved an issue where Shadow of the Source sometimes did not move in phase 2’s Beyond the Bounds of Truth.
      • Resolved an issue where Abnormal Status effects were not applied when hit by Snatching Grasp or Mastermind Glutton in phase 3.
    • Papulatus (Normal)
      • Resolved an issue where HP couldn’t be recovered by absorbing Otherworld Papulatus phase 2.
    • Resolved an issue with text spacings when an Elite Monster or Boss had a modifier.
    • Resolved an issue where mobs that do not move horizontally could have their movement reset based on the character’s location.

    Back to Top

    Map/Movement Improvements and Changes

    Town Portal

    • A new Town Portal has been added to all Major Towns!

    • To use the Town Portal, click Town Portal or press the up arrow key near the portal to open the Town Portal UI.

    • You can teleport to any of the three continents: Maple World, Grandis, and Arcane River. Once a continent is selected, you can choose your destination town.

    Hyper Teleport Rock Changes

    • The Hyper Teleport Rock functionality is now considered a core feature of the game’s movement system and will be integrated into the new World Map UI.
    • The Hyper Teleport Rock is usable in maps without teleport restrictions.
    • Each use has a 5-minute cooldown and applies only to the character that used it.
    • The purchase and sale of Teleport Rocks, Hyper Teleport Rocks, and VIP Teleport Rocks from the Cash Shop will end after the maintenance on June 11, 2025.
      • Players who already own Teleport Rocks before the maintenance on June 11, 2025 can continue using them until they expire, along with the ‘chase character’ feature. Note: This means permanent Teleport Rocks can still be used forever.

    Premium Hyper Teleport Rock

    • The Premium Hyper Teleport Rock instantly removes the cooldown for that teleport when activated.
    • The effect applies immediately upon purchase and lasts for the selected duration from the time of purchase.
      • Buying additional Premium Hyper Teleport Rocks will extend the remaining duration by the amount purchased.
    • Premium Hyper Teleport Rock can be obtained by purchasing through the World Map UI or with Premium Hyper Teleport Rock Coupon.
    Premium Hyper Teleport Rock Prices
    Duration Interactive World Price
    (Maple Points)    		 Heroic World Price
    (Meso)
    1 Day 500 5,200,000
    7 Days 2,500 25,000,000
    31 Days 7,800 100,000,000

    World Map Revamp

    • A new Map Info section has been added to the World Map UI. When you select a map, this panel displays detailed information including:
      • Type of Map: Town, Instanced Map, Regular Map
      • Minimum entry level and entry quest requirements
      • Star Force, Arcane Power, Sacred Power requirements
      • NPC and enemy details.

    • You can now view the map your character is currently on, as well as up to four higher-level maps depending on your current location, helping you plan your next move more easily!
    • A filter feature has been added to the search UI where you can narrow down your search by category:
      • Enemy (The level range can be set)
      • NPC
      • Map
    • Map information in the world map UI now display text in different colors to indicate what category it belongs to:
      • Enemies - Red
      • NPC - Blue
      • Maps - Green
    • You can now change the order of your Favorite maps! In the Favorite section, right click on a map name and select the ‘Change Location’ button to rearrange how they appear.

    • A Hyper Teleport Rock button has been added to the World Map UI. Double-click on a map or click the ‘Hyper Teleport Rock’ button, then press ‘Go Now’ after selecting your destination.

    • The teleport can also be triggered by clicking the ‘Go Now’ button in the navigation UI.
    • The Hyper Teleport Rock has a 5-minute cooldown and the timer is displayed directly in the UI.
      • The cooldown for any World Teleport Map items you already own is not reflected here.
    • A Premium Hyper Teleport Rock button has been added onto the World Map UI. The button changes color when a Premium Hyper Teleport Rock is active.

    • Removed the Smart Mount feature and can no longer be used.
    • Removed the following Smart Mount quests:
      • [Smart Mount] That Thing for Manji
      • [Smart Mount] Wing's Homework
      • [Smart Mount] Mrs. Ming Ming's Lunchbox
      • [Smart Mount] Lend a Hand
      • [Smart Mount] Irvin and Social Responsibility
      • [Auto-Pilot Mount] Irvin's Customer Care Center
      • [Smart Mount] Success with Irvin
      • [Smart Mount] Irvin's Gift

    Mini-Map Revamp

    The mini-map UI has been revamped with new features making navigating to any destination absolutely lightwork.

    • A Move to Town feature has been added.
      • Hover the mouse over the Move to Town button and the name of the nearest town will appear. Clicking the button will instantly move you to the town.
        • The feature cannot be used in areas with Teleport restrictions.

    • A button to open the Navigation UI has been added.
    • The NPC list of the map you’re in can now be sorted by feature, name, and location.
    • A filter feature has been added where you can choose what NPC and character to appear on your mini-map. The following categories can be filtered:
      • NPC: Normal, Shop, Storage Keeper, Special/Event, Teleport.
      • Character: My Character, Party, Friend/Spouse, Guild/Alliance.

    • Some icons on the mini-map have been changed.
    • The Return Scroll - Nearest Town item will be removed from all General Stores
    • The ‘Return Scroll - Nearest Town Tutorial’ will be removed.

    Common Map

    • Changed so players are teleported to the original map when entering Karote Summit via the Boss UI or Maple Planner.
    • Resolved an issue where a red dot sometimes appeared at the Minar Forest: Crossroad to the Canyon map.
    • Resolved an issue allowing ability resets in event maps.
    • Resolved an issue where portals did not work under certain conditions in Odium: The Wellspring.

    Back to Top

    NPC Improvements and Changes

    • Resolved an issue where NPC Oz’s image displayed incorrectly in the Black Heaven story.

    Back to Top

    Item Improvements and Changes

    • Daily Gift Reward Changes
      • Starting July 1, 2025 at 12:00 AM UTC, the Hyper Teleport Rock from the Daily Gift will be replaced with a Premium Hyper Teleport Rock Coupon (1-day): Tradable within world, 7-day duration.
    • Angelic Buster Compact Item
      • Updated the Compact item tooltip to explain that the compact dress will not appear when a cash outfit, top, bottom, and shoes are equipped.
      • Improved where the Compact can be equipped on its own without also equipping the exclusive dress when removing other outfits (outfit, top, bottom, shoes).
        • When the Compact is equipped while still wearing a full outfit set, the exclusive dress appearance will not be shown.
        • To confirm that the Compact is equipped, open the Cash tab in the character’s Inventory UI and see if the Compact has an equipped mark (E) on it.
    • VIP Boosters
      • Changed what completion counts Flame Monsters summoned using a VIP Booster will now count towards:
        • MAPLE Daily Gift
        • Harvesting/Mining requirements
        • Legion Artifact Weekly Missions
        • Guild Weekly Hunting Points
        • Achievement: Enemies Near your Level Defeat Count
    • Potential Stamps
      • Changed where Potential Stamp items can now be used on Genesis Lazuli and Genesis Lapis if they have 2 lines of Potential or Bonus Potential
    • Added the Maplemas version of Cernium BGM to the playlist for the Yeti Snowball Fight Chair and Pink Bean Snowball Fight Chair.
    • Updated the Pet Equipment Pure Clean Slate Scroll 100% item description.
    • Updated the spacing for pet equipment names.
    • Resolved an issue where the icon was positioned incorrectly for the Apprentice Witch Hallowkitty Emoticon.
    • Resolved an issue where players appeared on ladders or ropes with their androids.
    • Resolved an issue where the back images looked awkward when Brown and White Hare Expedition Backpacks were equipped.
    • Resolved an issue where the Maple Style Magazine, Exciting Home Party, and Dream Debut Performance Chair sometimes displayed incorrectly.
    • Resolved an issue where item skills appeared incorrectly in the Skill UI after unequipping.
    • Resolved an issue where cash items with a skill, when equipped using the Outfit Preset, could not be used.
    • Resolved an issue where Beta characters couldn’t use skills on cash items with a skill.
    • Resolved an issue where Luminous could relearn all 1st Job Light and Darkness skills using the Special SP Reset Scroll.
    • Resolved an issue where the effects of some Effect Rings were visible on non-humanoid androids.
    • Resolved an issue where the Kanao Hair shadow appeared awkward.
    • Resolved an issue where Maha the Polearm sometimes displayed strangely.
    • Resolved an issue where Green, Purple, and Blue Drag Pets had awkward chat bubble images.
    • Resolved an issue where the pet label image for Green Drag looked awkward.
    • Resolved an issue where Jade Silk Outfit (M) and Jade Silk Outfit (F) sometimes appeared awkward.
    • Resolved an issue where pets with the auto-potion skill learned had limited potion use when attacked by enemies.

    Back to Top

    Smart AI Correction

    • A new graphics setting has been added to make the game look smoother, making character movement, skill effects and enemy actions feel faster.
    • Smart AI Correction can be enabled in the Options UI under the ‘Graphics’ tab.
      • We recommend enabling V-Sync when using this feature.

    • Please note that some text in labels, Medals, and Titles may appear distorted if you move too quickly.
    • If the feature causes screen glitches or performance issues, it’s recommended to have this feature disabled.

    Back to Top

    DirectX 11

    MapleStory now officially supports DirectX 11!

    DirectX 11 will be supported after the v.260 update on June 11, 2025 to provide a more enjoyable gaming experience. We ask that you update to DirectX 11.0 or higher to ensure your game runs smoothly as support for DirectX 9 will end from that point onwards.

    Troubleshooting

    If the game doesn’t launch or you see a DirectX-related error after the update, we recommend checking your system’s DirectX version and updating if needed.

    • To download and update DirectX to the latest version, click HERE.

    Back to Top

    Morning Star Banquet Events

    Morning Star Banquet

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who completed ‘Gob’s Call’ quest or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Are y’all HUNGRY? Our Morning Star Feast has begun and it's time to pig out! Join us on our daily feast and claim some delicious rewards~

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Morning Star Feast’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
      • Alternatively, you can talk to the Head Servant NPC located in the Event Map, Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens, and complete the ‘[Morning Star] Perfect Feast Prep’ quest.
    • Keep up with your progress by clicking ‘Morning Star Feast’ from the Event List.
    • All characters within your account share your progress!

    Morning Star Feast

    • Daily Feast Prep
      • You can complete your Daily Feast Prep by clicking ‘Daily Feast Prep’ from the Event UI from the respective day. Upon checking in your Daily Feast Prep, you will receive the following:
        • 3x EXP Coupon (30 min) (x3)
        • Morning Light skill points (x5)
        • Starlight skill points (x5)
      • The Daily Feast Prep can be completed 5 times a week per account. You can obtain set rewards based on your cumulative Daily Feast Prep count.
      • You can claim these rewards by clicking the ‘Claim’ button, then select between the Memento Coin and the Daily Feast Prep reward item.
        • Please keep in mind, you will not be able to change your claimed item after selecting!
      • The Memento Coin quantity will differ from each Daily Feast Prep depending on the reward item.
      • Daily Feast Prep can be done up to 50 times overall within the event period.
    • Special Feast Prep
      • Defeat 2,000 monsters within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above) to complete a check-in. Upon checking in your Special Feast Prep, you will receive the following:
        • Memento Coin x1,000
      • Memento Coins can be used to exchange for various items within the Memento Coin Exchange shop!
      • Each check-in can be completed up to 3 times a week per account and cleared 3 times at once. Special Feast Prep can be done up to 30 times overall within the event period.
      • Complete all of the Special Feast Prep and you can obtain Hyper Burninator x1
        • Burning perks will be available until November 11, 2025.
    Special Feast Prep Check-in records reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC
    • Daily Feast Pass and Special Feast Pass
      • Missed a day of the Daily or Special Feast Prep? Use 3,000 Maple Points to purchase either the Daily Feast Prep or the Special Feast Prep check-in!
      • The total number of missed check-ins and Daily/Special Feast Passes available for purchase reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC each week.

    Daily Feast Prep Rewards

    • You can claim these items anytime within the event period.
    • You can choose to claim either the daily feast prep reward item or the memento coin.
